MessagesTemplates module

class MessagesTemplates.MessagesTemplates[source]

Bases: object

Provides templates for generating Z3 solver function definitions, result checks, global variable reset functions, and variable declaration blocks for use in smart contract verification scripts.

static getFunctionActionDefinition(funtionData)[source]

Generates a Z3 solver function definition from provided function data.

Parameters:

functionData (dict) – A dictionary containing information about the function, such as name, global variables, parameters, and conditions.

Returns:

A string representing the complete function definition in Python code.

Return type:

str

static getFunctionVariableDeclaration(variable_name, value, solver_name)[source]

Generates code for declaring a variable and adding it to a Z3 solver instance.

Parameters:

  • variable_name (str) – The name of the variable to declare.

  • value – The value to assign to the variable.

  • solver_name (str) – The name of the Z3 solver instance.

Returns:

A string containing Python code for the variable declaration and solver addition.

Return type:

str

static getMessageWhenVarNotGlobal(assignation_str, solver_name)[source]

Generates a message indicating that a variable does not meet assignment requirements.

Parameters:

  • assignation_str (str) – The assignment string that failed to meet requirements.

  • solver_name (str) – The name of the Z3 solver instance.

Returns:

A string containing Python code to add a false condition to the solver.

Return type:

str

static getResetGlobalFunction(deploy_vars, var_names=[])[source]

Generates a function for resetting global variables to their deployment values.

Parameters:

  • deploy_vars (str) – A string containing the deployment variable assignments.

  • var_names (list[str]) – A list of variable names to be declared as global.

Returns:

A string representing the function definition in Python code.

Return type:

str

static getResultCheckPart()[source]

Returns a template string for printing the verification result.

Returns:

A string containing Python code for printing the verification verdict.

Return type:

str
